Description.Text: At Hatton Court Hotel in Gloucester the hotel's aim is to offer the guests the very warmest of welcomes. Choose from the range of individually styled bedrooms - many with whirlpool baths and other little touches to help you relax and enjoy your stay. Despite its imposing appearance today, the original house that forms the heart of Hatton Court was built in the 1920's as a home for the mistress of a prominent local businessman, so rumour has it. It was first put to use as a hotel in the 1950's and called the 'Tara' which is an old Gaelic word meaning 'hill.'

Hatton Court is ideally located for Cheltenham Gold Cup 2012 being a mere 12 miles from the Cheltenham National Hunt race course. - Prinknash Abbey (pronounced 'Prinnish') is a Catholic Benedictine monastery situated in the Vale of Gloucester in the Diocese of Clifton, near the village of Cranham. - Gloucester Cathedral - Worship has taken place in this wonderful building for 900 years and it continues as a place of prayer and Christian pilgrimage. - Gloucester Quays Designer Outlet has an outstanding mix of high street and designer labels at up to 60% off recommended retail prices. - Gloucester Rugby - Hatton Court is just 3 miles from Kingsholm, the home of the famous Cherry & Whites, Gloucester Rugby Club - Gloucester Docks and River Cruises- The former dock estate has become a popular destination where visitors can enjoy interesting views and a range of modern facilities while wandering around a remarkably complete example of a Victorian port.
Standard Double - Standard Double room offers 1 double bed with all the basic amenities.
